articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: First American dies from coronavirus in Wuhan, China
articles.description: The Chinese government is scrambling to contain the coronavirus outbreak, with disturbing videos on social media showing its extreme measures to quarantine the sick. More Americans arrived overnight in the U.S. from Wuhan with no more evacuation flights plann…

articles.author: Minyvonne Burke, Suzanne Ciechalski, Leou Chen, Dawn Liu
articles.title: Video appears to show people in China forcibly taken for quarantine over coronavirus
articles.description: Two videos have surfaced on social media that appear to show people in China being taken for quarantine or isolation over the coronavirus, which has sickened tens of thousands and killed more than 700 people in the country.
articles.content:
Two videos have surfaced on social media that appear to show people in China being taken for quarantine or isolation over the coronavirus, which has sickened tens of thousands and killed more than 700 people in the country.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Videos appear to show people taken into quarantine for coronavirus in China
articles.description: Videos from social media appear to show people being taken into quarantine for the coronavirus in the Jiangsu Province of China.

articles.author: Sasha Urban
articles.title: Safe in quarantine in the U.S., worried about family back home in China
articles.description: Coronavirus quarantine in the U.S.: Yu Lin Yin was in Wuhan, China, when he secured a spot on a plane carrying nearly 200 people.
articles.content: By the time the Chinese government locked down the city of Wuhan on Jan. 23, Yu Lin Yin and his elderly parents were already self-quarantined in their condo, a precaution they took in the face of locals' growing concerns over an unidentified virus that was qu… [+3140 chars]

articles.author: NBC News
articles.title: Coronavirus updates: U.S., Japanese citizens die in Wuhan and global deaths at least 724
articles.description: Coronavirus updates: Global death toll hits 724, with most in China. An American with coronavirus died in Wuhan. A Japanese citizen suspected of having it also died there.
articles.content:
Global death toll rises to at least 724 as confirmed cases reach more than 34,500 in mainland China
 A 60-year-old U.S. citizen with coronavirus died Thursday in Wuhan, embassy says
Japanese citizen in their 60s suspected to have died from virus in Wuhan

articles.author: Phil Helsel
articles.title: American with coronavirus died in Wuhan, China, embassy says
articles.description: A 60-year-old U.S. citizen diagnosed with novel coronavirus died Thursday at a Wuhan, China, hospital, the U.S. embassy confirmed.
articles.content:
A U.S. citizen diagnosed with novel coronavirus has died in China in what appears to be the first death of an American from the virus that has sickened tens of thousands of people in China and killed more than 700, a U.S. embassy spokesperson said.

articles.author: Kimmy Yam
articles.title: The Wall Street Journal criticized for op-ed with derogatory reference to China in title
articles.description: The phrase “sick man of Asia” has been historically used to perpetuate the stereotype that Chinese people were disease-ridden and unclean.
articles.content:
An op-ed that appeared this week in The Wall Street Journal, comparing Chinas financial markets to a market linked to the coronavirus outbreak, has prompted social media users to accuse the outlet of perpetuating anti-Chinese sentiments.
